required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Burden of Herpes Zoster and Post-herpetic Neuralgia Among People ≥ 50 Years Old in France
clinical_study.official_title: Burden of Herpes Zoster and Post-herpetic Neuralgia Among People ≥ 50 Years Old in France: the POSTHER Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the burden of Herpes zoster (HZ) and post-herpetic neuralgia (PHN) among people ≥ 50 years old in France, in terms of healthcare resources used, medical direct and indirect costs, as well as pain severity and impact on quality of life.

detailed_description.textblock:
- An observational, prospective cohort study of patients ≥ 50 years old with a Herpes Zoster (HZ) diagnosis, carried out by a national random sample of community first line practitioners concerned by HZ diagnosis: general practitioners, dermatologists and ophthalmologists.
- All patients ≥ 50 years old with a HZ diagnosis (as the primary diagnoses and without history of previous HZ) during approximately 6 months inclusion period will be included in the HZ cohort, until total study target is achieved.
- All Patients of the HZ cohort presenting a Post-herpetic neuralgia (PHN) 3 months after onset of the HZ rash onset will be included secondarily in the PHN cohort
- Patients of the HZ cohort will be followed-up for 3 months (i.e. 1 and 3 months after HZ rash onset) and patients of the PHN cohort will be followed-up for additional 6 months (i.e., 6 and 9 months after HZ rash onset) using phone interviews with a nurse.
- 250 cases of HZ and 40 cases of PHN are expected, with the hypothesis of 16% of PHN 3 months after HZ rash onset.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of Herpes Zoster (HZ) and Postherpetic Neuralgia (PHN) Related Direct Medical Costs by Drugs Prescribed.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of HZ and PHN related direct medical costs were done by the drugs prescribed before and at inclusion. The drugs prescribed were defined as a direct cost.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Related Direct and Indirect Medical Costs by Sick Leave Prescription and Medical Visit
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of HZ and PHN related indirect costs, estimated by direct medical costs were done by the sick leave prescription and medical visit at inclusion. Sick leave prescriptions were defined as an indirect medical cost and medical visits were defined as a direct medical cost.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Related Direct and Indirect Medical Costs by Drugs Prescribed, Sick Leave Prescription and Medical Visits
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of HZ and PHN related direct medical costs were done by drugs prescribed, sick leaves prescribed, medical visits to a specialist and patient reference to a hospital.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Related Direct and Indirect Medical Costs by Drugs Prescribed, Sick Leave Prescription and Medical Visits
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of HZ and PHN related direct and indirect medical costs were done by the drugs prescribed, sick leaves prescribed and medical visits from month 3 to month 6 for the PHN cohort

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Related Direct and Indirect Medical Costs by Drugs Prescribed, Sick Leave Prescription and Medical Visits
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of HZ and PHN related direct and indirect medical costs were done by the drugs prescribed, sick leaves prescribed and medical visits from month 6 to month 9 for the PHN cohort

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Severity for Last 24 Hour Worst Pain From the ZBPI Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: HZ and PHN severity was evaluated using 3 categories- mild pain (0<pain<3), moderate pain (3 ≤ pain < 7) and severe pain (7 ≤ pain) for the last 24 hour worst pain. The Zoster Brief Pain Inventory (ZBPI) questionnaire is a self-administered form to assess HZ pain and burden associated with HZ pain using scales from: 0 for no pain to 10 for the most horrible pain that can be imagined, 0 for no improvement to 100% for full improvement with painkiller, 0 for no burden to 10 for full burden.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Severity for Last 24 Hour Worst Pain From the ZBPI Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: HZ and PHN severity was evaluated using 3 categories- mild pain (0<pain<3), moderate pain (3 ≤ pain < 7) and severe pain (7 ≤ pain) for the last 24 hour worst pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of Impact of HZ and PHN on Quality of Life (QOL) and Utilities Using EQ-5D-5L Questionnarie
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of HZ & PHN on QOL was evaluated using EQ-5D-5L questionnaire,which has 2 parts: EQ-5D-5L descriptive system & EQ Visual analogue scale(EQ-VAS). EQ-5D-5L descriptive system comprises of 5 dimensions-mobility,self-care,usual activities,pain/discomfort & anxiety/depression.Each dimension has 5 levels:not at all(level 1),mild(level 2),moderate(level 3),severe(level 4),extreme/leading to incapacity(level 5),with highest level corresponding to worst outcome.Subjects had to indicate their health state by choosing the appropriate level from each dimension.The 5 digit health states thus obtained for each dimension were then converted into a single mean index value using the EQ-5D-5L crosswalk index value calculator as recommended by EuroQol group.In the EQ-VAS,subjects had to record their health state on a scale ranging from 0(worst imaginable health state) to 100(best imaginable health state).A mean of this health state was recorded for subjects analyzed in this outcome measure

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of Impact of HZ and PHN on Quality of Life and Utilities Using EQ-5D-5L for PHN Cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of HZ & PHN on QOL was evaluated using EQ-5D-5L questionnaire,which has 2 parts: EQ-5D-5L descriptive system & EQ Visual analogue scale(EQ-VAS). EQ-5D-5L descriptive system comprises of 5 dimensions-mobility,self-care,usual activities,pain/discomfort & anxiety/depression.Each dimension has 5 levels:not at all(level 1),mild(level 2),moderate(level 3),severe(level 4),extreme/leading to incapacity(level 5),with highest level corresponding to worst outcome.Subjects had to indicate their health state by choosing the appropriate level from each dimension.The 5 digit health states thus obtained for each dimension were then converted into a single median index value using the EQ-5D-5L crosswalk index value calculator as recommended by EuroQol group.In the EQ-VAS,subjects had to record their health state on a scale ranging from 0(worst imaginable health state) to 100(best imaginable health state).A median of this health state was recorded for subjects analyzed in this outcome measure

arm_group.description: All patients ≥ 50 years old with a HZ diagnosis (as the primary diagnoses and no earlier case of HZ) during approximately 6 months inclusion period will be included in the HZ cohort, until total study target is achieved.

intervention.description: Data sheet, ZBPI questionnaire and EQ-5D 5L Health state questionnaire

study_pop.textblock: The study has been designed to include 250 patients ≥ 50 years old with a first visit for diagnosis of HZ during a 6-month inclusion period (HZ cohort) and 40 expected cases of PHN after 3 months of HZ rash onset.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For HZ cohort
- Patient with a first visit for a diagnosis of HZ and who attend the clinic within two week of the HZ start of symptoms,
- Without history of previous HZ,
- ≥ 50 years old,
- Who agree to participate and signed informed consent,
- Able to understand the study, to complete self-administered questionnaires and to answer phone interviews.
- For PHN cohort
- All Patients of the HZ cohort presenting PHN 3 months after onset of the HZ rash onset will be included in the PHN cohort. PHN will be defined as the presence of HZ-associated severe pains: ≥ 3 of the ZBPI item "worst pain".
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Inclusion timeframe for the study was initially planned for 6 months. Due to the low rate of inclusion, this timeframe was extended from 6 to 13.5 months. A total of 106 subjects from the Herpes Zoster (HZ) cohort were included in this study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Out of 106 subjects included,5 subjects were excluded due to the following reasons:<50 years,previous history of HZ ,not the first visit,consulted physician more than 2 weeks after start of HZ symptoms. A total of 101 subjects were included for analysis.Out of the 101 subjects,90 subjects completed the study.

group.title: HZ Cohort
group.description: All subjects ≥ 50 years old with an HZ diagnosis as the primary diagnosis during the inclusion period were included in the HZ cohort and followed up for 3 months from inclusion (month 0).

group.title: HZ Cohort
group.description: All subjects ≥ 50 years old with an HZ diagnosis as the primary diagnosis during the inclusion period were included in the HZ cohort and followed up for 3 months from inclusion (month 0).

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Evaluation of Herpes Zoster (HZ) and Postherpetic Neuralgia (PHN) Related Direct Medical Costs by Drugs Prescribed.
outcome.description: Evaluation of HZ and PHN related direct medical costs were done by the drugs prescribed before and at inclusion. The drugs prescribed were defined as a direct cost.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on subjects who were diagnosed with HZ, complied with inclusion criteria and on subjects belonging to a sub-cohort (PHN cohort) from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months and followed up for 6 more months.

group.title: HZ Cohort
group.description: All subjects ≥ 50 years old with an HZ diagnosis as the primary diagnosis during the inclusion period were included in the HZ cohort and followed up for 3 months from inclusion (month 0).

group.title: PHN Cohort
group.description: All subjects from the HZ cohort, who reported PHN at 3 months were included in the PHN sub cohort and were followed up for 6 more months (up to 9 months from inclusion).

measure.title: Evaluation of Herpes Zoster (HZ) and Postherpetic Neuralgia (PHN) Related Direct Medical Costs by Drugs Prescribed.
measure.description: Evaluation of HZ and PHN related direct medical costs were done by the drugs prescribed before and at inclusion. The drugs prescribed were defined as a direct cost.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on subjects who were diagnosed with HZ, complied with inclusion criteria and on subjects belonging to a sub-cohort (PHN cohort) from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months and followed up for 6 more months.

outcome.description: Evaluation of HZ and PHN related direct and indirect medical costs were done by the drugs prescribed, sick leaves prescribed and medical visits from month 3 to month 6 for the PHN cohort
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on subjects diagnosed with HZ who complied with inclusion criteria & on subjects belonging to PHN sub-cohort from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months & followed up for 6 more months. This endpoint is presented separately for PHN cohort due to difference in timeframe for HZ cohort (0-3 months),PHN cohort (3-9 months).

outcome.title: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Severity for Last 24 Hour Worst Pain From the ZBPI Questionnaire
outcome.description: HZ and PHN severity was evaluated using 3 categories- mild pain (0<pain<3), moderate pain (3 ≤ pain < 7) and severe pain (7 ≤ pain) for the last 24 hour worst pain. The Zoster Brief Pain Inventory (ZBPI) questionnaire is a self-administered form to assess HZ pain and burden associated with HZ pain using scales from: 0 for no pain to 10 for the most horrible pain that can be imagined, 0 for no improvement to 100% for full improvement with painkiller, 0 for no burden to 10 for full burden.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the subjects who were diagnosed with HZ, complied with inclusion criteria and on subjects belonging to a sub-cohort (PHN cohort) from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months and followed up for 6 more months.

group.description: All subjects ≥ 50 years old with an HZ diagnosis as the primary diagnosis during the inclusion period were included in the HZ cohort and followed up for 3 months from inclusion (month 0).

measure.title: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Severity for Last 24 Hour Worst Pain From the ZBPI Questionnaire
measure.description: HZ and PHN severity was evaluated using 3 categories- mild pain (0<pain<3), moderate pain (3 ≤ pain < 7) and severe pain (7 ≤ pain) for the last 24 hour worst pain. The Zoster Brief Pain Inventory (ZBPI) questionnaire is a self-administered form to assess HZ pain and burden associated with HZ pain using scales from: 0 for no pain to 10 for the most horrible pain that can be imagined, 0 for no improvement to 100% for full improvement with painkiller, 0 for no burden to 10 for full burden.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the subjects who were diagnosed with HZ, complied with inclusion criteria and on subjects belonging to a sub-cohort (PHN cohort) from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months and followed up for 6 more months.

outcome.title: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Severity for Last 24 Hour Worst Pain From the ZBPI Questionnaire
outcome.description: HZ and PHN severity was evaluated using 3 categories- mild pain (0<pain<3), moderate pain (3 ≤ pain < 7) and severe pain (7 ≤ pain) for the last 24 hour worst pain.
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on subjects diagnosed with HZ who complied with inclusion criteria & on subjects belonging to PHN sub-cohort from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months & followed up for 6 more months. measure.title: Evaluation of HZ and PHN Severity for Last 24 Hour Worst Pain From the ZBPI Questionnaire
measure.description: HZ and PHN severity was evaluated using 3 categories- mild pain (0<pain<3), moderate pain (3 ≤ pain < 7) and severe pain (7 ≤ pain) for the last 24 hour worst pain.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on subjects diagnosed with HZ who complied with inclusion criteria & on subjects belonging to PHN sub-cohort from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months & followed up for 6 more months. This endpoint is presented separately for PHN cohort due to difference in timeframe for HZ cohort (0-3 months),PHN cohort (3-9 months).

outcome.title: Evaluation of Impact of HZ and PHN on Quality of Life (QOL) and Utilities Using EQ-5D-5L Questionnarie
outcome.description: Impact of HZ & PHN on QOL was evaluated using EQ-5D-5L questionnaire,which has 2 parts: EQ-5D-5L descriptive system & EQ Visual analogue scale(EQ-VAS). EQ-5D-5L descriptive system comprises of 5 dimensions-mobility,self-care,usual activities,pain/discomfort & anxiety/depression.Each dimension has 5 levels:not at all(level 1),mild(level 2),moderate(level 3),severe(level 4),extreme/leading to incapacity(level 5),with highest level corresponding to worst outcome.Subjects had to indicate their health state by choosing the appropriate level from each dimension.The 5 digit health states thus obtained for each dimension were then converted into a single mean index value using the EQ-5D-5L crosswalk index value calculator as recommended by EuroQol group.In the EQ-VAS,subjects had to record their health state on a scale ranging from 0(worst imaginable health state) to 100(best imaginable health state).A mean of this health state was recorded for subjects analyzed in this outcome measure
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the subjects who were diagnosed with HZ, complied with inclusion criteria and on subjects belonging to a sub-cohort (PHN cohort) from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months and followed up for 6 more months.

EQ-5D-5L descriptive system comprises of 5 dimensions-mobility,self-care,usual activities,pain/discomfort & anxiety/depression.Each dimension has 5 levels:not at all(level 1),mild(level 2),moderate(level 3),severe(level 4),extreme/leading to incapacity(level 5),with highest level corresponding to worst outcome.Subjects had to indicate their health state by choosing the appropriate level from each dimension.The 5 digit health states thus obtained for each dimension were then converted into a single mean index value using the EQ-5D-5L crosswalk index value calculator as recommended by EuroQol group.In the EQ-VAS,subjects had to record their health state on a scale ranging from 0(worst imaginable health state) to 100(best imaginable health state).A mean of this health state was recorded for subjects analyzed in this outcome measure
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the subjects who were diagnosed with HZ, complied with inclusion criteria and on subjects belonging to a sub-cohort (PHN cohort) from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months and followed up for 6 more months.

outcome.description: Impact of HZ & PHN on QOL was evaluated using EQ-5D-5L questionnaire,which has 2 parts: EQ-5D-5L descriptive system & EQ Visual analogue scale(EQ-VAS). EQ-5D-5L descriptive system comprises of 5 dimensions-mobility,self-care,usual activities,pain/discomfort & anxiety/depression.Each dimension has 5 levels:not at all(level 1),mild(level 2),moderate(level 3),severe(level 4),extreme/leading to incapacity(level 5),with highest level corresponding to worst outcome.Subjects had to indicate their health state by choosing the appropriate level from each dimension.The 5 digit health states thus obtained for each dimension were then converted into a single median index value using the EQ-5D-5L crosswalk index value calculator as recommended by EuroQol group.In the EQ-VAS,subjects had to record their health state on a scale ranging from 0(worst imaginable health state) to 100(best imaginable health state).A median of this health state was recorded for subjects analyzed in this outcome measure
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on subjects diagnosed with HZ who complied with inclusion criteria & on subjects belonging to PHN sub-cohort from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months & followed up for 6 more months. This endpoint is presented separately for PHN cohort due to difference in timeframe for HZ cohort (0-3 months),PHN cohort (3-9 months).

measure.population: Analysis was performed on subjects diagnosed with HZ who complied with inclusion criteria & on subjects belonging to PHN sub-cohort from HZ cohort, diagnosed with PHN at 3 months & followed up for 6 more months. reported_events.time_frame: No adverse events data were collected.
reported_events.desc: No adverse events data were collected

group.title: HZ Cohort
group.description: All subjects ≥ 50 years old with an HZ diagnosis as the primary diagnosis during the inclusion period were included in the HZ cohort and followed up for 3 months from inclusion (month 0).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
